title: ECON1550 International Finance
text:
Where to Find Course Materials
Canvas is the official home for this course. Everything you need—announcements, assignments, grades, policies, and course materials—is available there.
This website and the GitHub repository mirror the course materials and offer a few extras:

LaTeX source files — edit or build upon the original source code for problem sets and notes
Modification dates — see exactly when each file was last updated
Repo history — see exactly what changed in each update
Programmatic access — clone the repo or use the GitHub API to automate your workflow
Frequently Asked Questions — answers to common questions about the course

If you just want to download PDFs, Canvas is simpler. This site is here for those who want more.

title: Accessibility
text:
Accessibility Statement
The ECON1550 International Finance course website is committed to ensuring digital accessibility for all users, including those with disabilities.

Standards
We aim to conform to WCAG 2.1 Level AA standards.


Features
This site includes the following accessibility features:

Semantic HTML structure with proper heading hierarchy
Keyboard navigation support with skip-to-content link
Responsive design for various devices and screen sizes
Sufficient color contrast
Descriptive link text



Feedback
If you encounter any accessibility barriers on this site, please submit an issue on our GitHub repository.


Reporting Issues
Please include:

The web address (URL) of the content
A description of the issue

title: Frequently Asked Questions
text:
Skip to main content







Will lectures be recorded?
No. Lectures are not recorded. If you miss class, get notes from a classmate and come to office hours with questions.








NoteStill have questions?



If your question isn’t answered here, post on Ed Discussion. You’ll get a faster response there than by email, and your classmates may benefit from the answer too.
